newsitem.title: VIETNAM: ADB proposes $1.5 bln lending programme to Vietnam.
newsitem.headline: ADB proposes $1.5 bln lending programme to Vietnam.

text.p: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has proposed a $1.5 billion lending programme to Vietnam for 1997-2000, the bank said in a statement on Wednesday.

The statement said the bank's loans were provided to Vietnam, one of the world's poorest countries, on terms which include repayment over 40 years with a 10-year grace period and a service charge of one percent.
About 40 percent of the lending would be chanelled into physical infrastructure such as transport and energy, the statement said.

Agriculture and natural resources would account for 25 percent. Social infrastructure would take up 25 percent and the remaining 10 percent would be shared by finance, industry and other sectors, it said.
It said the 1997-2000 lending programme would make Vietnam the largest recipient of ADB concessional funds.
